page.title: 12COMPLEX FOR THE HANDICAPPED.
page.content: WALTHAM LODGE is for handicapped people. It's built by John Groomes Housing Association and stands on the corner of Park Road and Goldsmith Road Leyton E10.Inside everything is on a low level so that people in wheelchairs can reach.There are levers for the taps and windows to make them easy to turn or open,and even the cooker is on a low level. Most things in the kitchen have gaps underneath so that people in wheelchairs can get close enough to work.In the bathroom by the toilet there is a wide gap so that they can slide out of their wheelchair and onto the toilet.Again there are 2 levers for the taps.In every room there is an orange lever so that if the person falls over or has an accident they can pull the lever and someone will come to help them.
